channel.title: thoughts on (´_ゝ`) the gooberverse
channel.description: Recent content in thoughts on (´_ゝ`) the gooberverse

item.title: oh it's fine you don't need to
item.description: have you ever met someone who, when you bring up their birthday, they’re like “oh it’s fine you don’t need to get me anything!" and then when you proceed to listen to them and get them nothing, they’re upset by it? you can probably think of at least one time this has happened and it’s pretty annoying. i mean, there’s something to be said about that line that they gave being a social cue that, yes, they would be

item.title: ignoring someone
item.description: is it an adult thing to do to ignore someone you’re in proximity with rather than working your problems out together? i’m all for a healthy amount of distancing, but i think outright ignoring someone is childish. confront each other with intention and purpose and not just for the sake of getting it over with, but do it for fucks' sake if you’re going to do it. we’re too old to be doing shit like

item.title: sleep apnea
item.description: my sleep apnea has been acting up recently. i attribute this to the weight i’ve gained over the winter. it’s quite annoying, and i didn’t realize how much of it was simply due to having more mass around your neck, so to speak. i think sleep apnea mostly affects overweight people rather than people who have something fucked up about their airway. i mean i’m sure not everyone with sleep apnea is overweight,

item.title: nothing changes if nothing changes
item.description: i’ve been getting a bunch of ads for the company burga, which manufactures phone cases with artistic designs and collaborations. one of them recently features some.. famous french dude? who has some sticky-note style handwritten quotes as the “art” for the phone case. one of the handwritten quotes is “nothing changes if nothing changes”, which is something i’ve always known but never put into words like that. i was aware that the cost of a new life is your current life.

item.title: bitingly cold
item.description: one time when i was in high school, i described the air as “sharp”. it was a description of how it felt to breathe extremely cold air into your nose with the massive temperature difference and speed of inhalation almost making it feel like a cut inside your nose. i like the weirdly precise descriptors we have for temperature like that. the air was sharp, it’s bitingly cold, it’s hot as balls.

item.title: couchsurfing
item.description: i think the reason it’s called couchsurfing is because you’re going from place to place, i.e., different couches, and crashing on them in sequence day to day. i believe that going to different couches is what makes it specifically count as couchsurfing. however, for the purposes of my life experience having never done that, i count the periods of time where i sleep on my couch instead of my bed

item.title: not every month has the same amount of days
item.description: something that i consider a personal failing is that i can’t remember what months have 30 days, and which ones have 31 days. (nevermind february and when it has 28 or 29 days). which is to say, i never bothered memorizing this information. it was never critical to learn. whether or not i knew which months were longer never helped me in a profound way. so it makes sense i didn’t learn it.
